page.title: 08NORTH HAY FARM
page.content: Seventy-five acres support a family of four(with seasonal help).Stock includes dairy and beef cattle, sheep, a working dog and a few cats.Five thousand hens will be purchased in July.In 1983 hens were discontinued due to unprofitability.There is no woodland.A copse was cut down for grazing purposes. No trees have been planted since. Grass is grown for silage and hay. Chemicals are used to control weeds and slurry used as fertilizer.The slurry pit is fenced off.Recently a bullock strayed into it but was extracted with difficulty. Milk is stored in tanks and emptied daily by tankers to be transported to Torrington milk factory. The village sewage plant is on the farm.
